title: Finding North Star Using Big Dipper
brief: Locate Polaris (North Star) using the Big Dipper constellation for true north direction.
steps: Step 1: Locate the Big Dipper constellation (7 stars shaped like a dipper).
Step 2: Identify the two 'pointer stars' that form the outer edge of the dipper's bucket.
Step 3: Draw an imaginary line from the bottom pointer star to the top pointer star.
Step 4: Extend this line about 5 times the distance between the pointer stars.
Step 5: The North Star (Polaris) will be found along this extended line.
Step 6: Draw an imaginary line from Polaris straight down to the horizon for true north.
warnings: Requires clear night sky with visible stars.
Don't confuse with Little Dipper - use Cassiopeia to confirm.
